info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 14 at 5:00PM EDT until July 14 at 6:30PM EDT by NWS Miami FL
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues.
* WHERE...A portion of southeast Florida, including the following counties, Broward and Miami-Dade.
* WHEN...Until 630 PM EDT.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 457 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated moderate to heavy rains continue in the Flood Advisory area. Rainfall amounts between 2 and 4 inches of rain have fallen from over the area from the previous thunderstorms along with the current moderate to heavy rains.. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area during the next couple of hours from the moderate to heavy rains. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Hialeah, Pembroke Pines, Miramar, Miami Lakes, Hialeah Gardens, Medley, Pennsuco, Palm Springs North, Intersection Krome And U.S. 27 and Country Club. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 630 PM EDT THIS EVENING
